TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Status/Pane extends System.Object
public: ref class VisualStyleElement::Status::Pane abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides a for a status bar pane. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Status.Pane.Normal%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Status.Pane> class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> that represents a pane in the status bar.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Status.Pane.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementStatusPane1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#230](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples/CS/Form1.cs#230)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#230](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples/VB/Form1.vb#230)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Normal As VisualStyleElement

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a status bar pane.
Docs.value: A that represents a status bar pane.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Status.Pane.Normal%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Status.Pane.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementStatusPane1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#230](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples/CS/Form1.cs#230)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#230](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples/VB/Form1.vb#230)]
